definitions: the process of increasing the volume of sound, especially using an amplifier

examples.text: even without amplification, her voice carries to the farthest corners

shortDefinitions: process of increasing volume of sound

definitions: the action of increasing the amplitude of an electrical signal or other oscillation

examples.text: the amplification of radio signals is possible

shortDefinitions: increasing of amplitude of electrical signal

definitions: the action of making something more marked or intense

examples.text: you're an actor in that you are using emotion and amplification of ideas to make your point

shortDefinitions: act of making something more marked or intense

definitions: the action of enlarging upon or adding detail to a story or statement

examples.text: the words 'no real prospect of succeeding' do not need any amplification
thanks to all who wrote in with corrections and amplifications

shortDefinitions: act of enlarging upon story or statement

definitions: the action of making multiple copies of a gene or DNA sequence

examples.text: a technique known as random amplification of polymorphic DNA
sequences were obtained from multiple amplifications from individual samples

shortDefinitions: act of making multiple copies of gene or DNA sequence
